words.definition: (Proper name) - Dhritarashtra was the oldest son of Vyasa and the widow of Vicitravirya. His younger brother Pandu had to rule the kingdom because Dhritarashtra was born blind. However, after Pandu's untimely death, Dhritarashtra held control temporarily while Pandu's sons were growing up. After some time, Dhritarashtra's sons siezed control, thus leading to the battle of Kurukshetra, before which the Gita was spoken.

cognates.Greek: ϝεπ, earlier form of επ and εῖπον (spoke)

words.definition: in the place of pilgrimage; law field

components.kuru: (Proper Name) King Kuru, the shared ancestor of Pandu and Dhritarashtra.

words.definition: Derived from the proper name: Pandu. This term refers to the sons of Pandu: Yudhishtira, Bhima, Arjuna, Nakula, and Sahadeva

cognates.Greek: Monier Williams proposed χρόνος, which is doubtful.

words.definition: (Proper Name) - Sanjaya was part soldier, part secretary to Dhritarashtra. In some versions of the tale, he's endowed with the gift of sight, and narrating the battle of Kurukshetra to the blind king from afar. In other versions, he returns from the battlefield to report the day's events. It was through him that the conversation between Krishna and Arjuna (Bhagavad-Gita) was related.
